author: Slidebean
description:
How companies fake being “100% renewable.”

Here’s the trick: companies can run on fossil fuels all year and still claim they’re “fully powered by renewables.”

They buy annual renewable energy certificates (RECs), meaning a solar credit from May in Texas can “offset” coal power used in Virginia in December.

Now, the Greenhouse Gas Protocol wants to change that with hourly matching:
⚡ If a data center uses 1 MW at 3 a.m., it must buy 1 MW of clean power from the same grid, at the same hour.

This one rule could redirect billions in clean energy investment and finally decide whether “green energy” means real decarbonization or just creative accounting.

👉Hear the full breakdown on: https://vist.ly/4d7r9
title: Your “100% renewable” company might be running on coal

author: Slidebean
description:
OpenAI might drop its “for humanity” mission for profit.

OpenAI was founded as a capped-profit company, designed to keep AI aligned with humanity, not shareholders.

But new reports say it’s planning to ditch that model and become a regular for-profit corporation. The reason? To raise more money for chips, talent, and speed to compete like any other tech giant.

The risk: it could shift control from safety boards to investors, fueling the next stage of the AI arms race.

So here’s the question: can a company serve humanity when its duty is to shareholders? 
 
👉Hear the full breakdown on The Slidebean Stand-Up; streaming now on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and all major podcast platforms.
title: OpenAI’s dropping the “AI for humanity” part
